summary: This is an email exchange between a Victim Witness Coordinator and another party regarding a victim who contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office. The victim, who met Epstein and Maxwell 25 years prior, called to inquire about attending the trial, shared details of her experience, and mentioned she had applied for the Victim Compensation Fund. The email provides trial logistics and acknowledges the victim's request for assistance.

persons.name: Victim Witness Coordinator
persons.context: The sender of the email, working at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, who relays information about a victim's call and provides trial access details.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the victim met 25 years ago, central to the case for which the trial is being held.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as someone the victim met 25 years ago, and is the subject of the upcoming trial.

connections.description: Both are mentioned together as individuals the victim met 25 years ago, indicating their association in the context of the alleged abuse.
The Coordinator is involved in the legal proceedings against Maxwell, providing trial information and victim support.
The Coordinator is involved in the legal case related to Epstein, though the trial is for Maxwell.

events.title: Victim Inquiry Call
events.description: A victim called the U.S. Attorney's Office hotline, stating it took her years to get the courage to call, and inquired about attending the trial. She mentioned meeting Epstein and Maxwell 25 years ago, having the gown and presents from that time, and applying for the Victim Compensation Fund.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Start
events.description: The trial for Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to begin in courtroom 318 at 40 Foley Square, New York, and is open to the public.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, New York 10007
40 Foley Square, New York, New York
keyFacts: A victim contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office, revealing she met Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell 25 years ago and had kept the gown and presents from that time.
The victim had previously called the FBI hotline but received no response, highlighting potential issues in victim outreach.
The victim has applied for the Victim Compensation Fund, indicating ongoing legal and reparative processes for Epstein case victims.
Ghislaine Maxwell's trial was scheduled to begin on November 29, 2021, at 40 Foley Square in New York, and was open to the public.
The Victim Witness Coordinator offered to provide court access information to help victims attend the trial, showing efforts to facilitate victim participation.
